newsitem.title: UK: Salomon upgrades Israel's Teledata EPS.
newsitem.headline: Salomon upgrades Israel's Teledata EPS.

text.p: Salomon Brothers has upgraded its earnings per share (EPS) forecast for 1996 for Israeli telecommunications equipment company Teledata Communications and reiterated its buy recommendation as a result of strong third-quarter results.

"For fourth-quarter 1996 we increase our revenue estimate from $16.9 million to $18.0 million and EPS from $0.20 to $0.21," Victor Halpert, Israel equity analyst at Salomon Brothers, said in a note to investors.
The broker said that the company recently indicated that fourth-quarter sales were fully booked in its backlog, "therefore we see very little downside risk for the period."
"We increase our full 1996 EPS projection from $0.64 to $0.66," the analyst added.
Salomon was bullish for the company's outlook for 1997, as well. "For 1997 we raise our revenues estimate from $74.2 million to 76.0 million, up 37 percent year-on-year," he said.
For 1998 Salomon projects an initial $98 million revenues and an EPS of $1.15, saying that its model assumed sales growth in all segments.
"In general, we expect Teledata to sustain more than 30 percent average annual sales growth in 1997 and 1998," the analyst said.
"Beyond that we are optimistic that current market fundamentals for access network products are strong and will continue to boost Teledata's operational performance."
"EPS is also expected to grow at an average annual rate above 30 percent in the same period."
